intro: Crepis serawschanica, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear chickweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It has small, hairy leaves and produces tiny white or pale yellow flowers. Crepis serawschanica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
